snippet: President Obama delivered to Speaker John A. Boehner a new offer that would raise revenues by $1.2 trillion over 10 years but maintain tax rates for any household earning below $400,000.
abstract: Pres Obama delivers to Speaker John A Boehner new offer to resolve pending fiscal crisis; proposal would raise revenues by $1.2 trillion over 10 years but maintain tax rates for any household earning below $400,000; offer is close to plan proposed by Boehner, and both sides express confidence that they are closing in on deal that could be passed well before January deadline.
lead_paragraph: President Obama delivered to Speaker John A. Boehner a new offer that would raise revenues by $1.2 trillion over 10 years but maintain tax rates for any household earning below $400,000.

headline.seo: President Delivers a New Offer on the Fiscal Crisis to Boehner
headline.main: Obama’s New Offer on Fiscal Crisis Could Lead to Deal
headline.print_headline: Obama Offers Fiscal Plan Close To G.O.P.’s, but Hurdles Remain
